intro: Campylocentrum barrerarum, commonly known as the Barrer's campylocentrum, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces woody capsules as its fruit. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments along creeklines and in understorey vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
